message.entry: Grid arrays must have NDGRID structure.
Input coordinates must be real.
Sample points vector corresponding to grid dimension {0,number,integer} must contain {1,number,integer} elements.
Interpolation requires at least two sample points for each grid dimension.
All input coordinates must have the same type. Input coordinates must be of type double or single.
GridVectors must define a grid whose size is compatible with the Values array.

Data is in MESHGRID format, NDGRID format is required.
Convert your data as follows:
 X = X'; Y = Y'; V = V'; F = griddedInterpolant(X,Y,V)
Sample points must be a cell of compact grid vectors.
The sample points must be finite.
Input coordinates must be of type double or single.
Sample points must be sorted in ascending order.
Sample points must be unique.
Interpolant is in an invalid state. GridVectors must define a grid whose size is compatible with the Values array.
Sparse input coordinates are not supported.
Sample values must be of type double or single.
The second input must specify the sample values.
Sparse sample values are not supported.
Expected the query points to be a matrix with {0,number,integer} columns.
Query coordinates input arrays must have the same size.
The cell must contain only vectors when specifying a grid in compact format using a cell.
All query coordinates must have the same type. Query coordinates must be of type double or single.
The extrapolation method must be ''linear'', ''nearest'', ''next'', ''previous'', ''pchip'', ''cubic'', ''spline'', ''makima'', or ''none''.
The interpolation method must be ''linear'', ''nearest'', ''next'', ''previous'', ''pchip'', ''cubic'', ''spline'', or ''makima''.
The ''cubic'' method requires at least 3 points in each dimension.\nReverting to the default ''linear'' method because this condition is not met.
The ''cubic'' method requires the grid to have a uniform spacing.\nSwitching the method from ''cubic'' to ''spline'' because this condition is not met.
The ''next'' method is only supported in 1D.\nReverting to the default ''linear'' method because this condition is not met.
The ''pchip'' method is only supported in 1D.\nReverting to the default ''linear'' method because this condition is not met.
The ''previous'' method is only supported in 1D.\nReverting to the default ''linear'' method because this condition is not met.
